titles.title: A bill to amend title 51, United States Code, to extend the authority of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to enter into leases of non-excess property of the Administration.
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Smith (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 7.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 390 - 0 (Roll no. 460).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
NASA Enhanced Use Leasing Extension Act of 2018
This bill extends through 2019 the authority for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to lease its non-excess real property and related personal property.
